intro: Euonymus indicus, commonly known as the Indian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Euonymus indicus is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
